title: Ross Henrick
text:
Ross Henrick (7 December 1954 – 8 May 2005) was an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1970s and 1980s. Nicknamed "The Angry Ant", he was a <a href="Queensland%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland</a> <a href="State%20of%20Origin">State of Origin</a> representative <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Stand-off">halfback</a>, and played club football in the <a href="Brisbane%20Rugby%20League">Brisbane Rugby League</a> premiership for <a href="Fortitude%20Valley%20Diehards">Fortitude Valley</a>, <a href="Norths%20Devils">Norths</a> and <a href="Redcliffe%20Dolphins">Redcliffe</a>.
Henrick played at halfback and scored a try in Norths' victory in the 1980 <a href="Brisbane%20Rugby%20League">Brisbane Rugby League</a> Grand Final.
Henrick was <a href="Wally%20Lewis">Wally Lewis</a>' partner in the halves for Queensland's victory in the <a href="1981%20State%20of%20Origin%20game">1981 State of Origin game</a>, the second ever. He was selected on Queensland's bench for Game II of the <a href="1983%20State%20of%20Origin%20series">1983 State of Origin series</a>. His final appearance for Queensland was at halfback in Game III of the <a href="1984%20State%20of%20Origin%20series">1984 State of Origin series</a>.
Henrick later coached <a href="Fortitude%20Valley%20Diehards">Fortitude Valley</a>, winning three BRL premierships with them.
From 1993 to 1999 Henrick coached <a href="Wavell%20State%20High%20School">Wavell State High School</a>'s rugby league team.
